Direct message the job poster from Acuity Eye Group
Janette Cardoza
Human Resources Recruiter at Acuity Eye Group
Director Data AnalyticsLocal Candidate (Southern California) required The Director is responsible for advancing application and infrastructure delivery within AEG’s line of business. They will play a critical role in the Data and Analytics (D&A), API development, data integration, business intelligence insights, and execution of health plan, optical, clinical, and IT strategies. The candidate must be highly skilled in SQL and complex stored procedures.Reporting directly to the Chief Information Officer, the Director of Data Analytics will bring industry-leading expertise in data strategy and insights, cloud-based data solutions, data implementations, and business-facing reporting. Departmental responsibilities include Data strategy for all business lines (including EHR, Optical Sales, Practice Management, Financials, and IT operation), Data Innovation, Data Roadmap, Data Architecture, The D&A Team, Execution, Support, Product/Program Management, and maintaining operational excellence.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily, with or without accommodation. The requirements listed below are representative, but not all-inclusive, of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.Immediate ResponsibilityData integration solutions based on AEG EHR, Google cloud infrastructure, optical sales, practice management, and enterprise data management.Build automated processes with notification of all AEG Data asset arrival into our business and reporting data warehouse.Evangelize data product roadmap and define data enrichment for short and long-term releases.Engage and manage cross-functional teams through all phases of Product development with emphasis on Agile (Sprint / Kanban) methodology, and serve as strategic liaison, facilitating ongoing communication and collaboration efforts.Contribute to the definition and implementation of Data Analytics deliveries with a focus on Health Plan, Financial, Optical Sales, and Clinical strategies that will drive growth, AEG performance, and revenue.Build analytic solutions using Google BigQuery data techniques and tools.Provide regular updates to senior executives on the activities, results, and budgets.Maintain and deliver TABLEAU business insights.Continued and progressive management of the D&A team.Other Duties and ResponsibilitiesCreate process documentation for data solutions and working directly with data architects on the roadmaps.Partner with internal and external stakeholders to identify research and analyze new requirements supporting data insights.Transformational leader that will expand and grow the Data and Analytics job family.Successful influencer to a broad range of stakeholders across the enterprise and deliver insights based on company vision.Manage / Deliver the development of enterprise business insights.Collaborate with third-party vendors on strategic data integration activities.Cultivate a high-performing organization which fosters teamwork and collaboration, leading by example.QUALIFICATION GUIDELINES:REQUIRED: Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance; minimum of 7 years related experience in business analytics and/or business intelligence, including staff management experience; or equivalent combination of education and work experience. Familiarity with Agile Environment. Experience with machine learning algorithms, statistical techniques, data interpretation methodologies, and deploying Predictive Models.DESIRABLE:Master’s Degree in Business, Public Health, or related degree preferred.Deep understanding of healthcare delivery systems and operations, including knowledge of medical economics, trend management, pricing, forecasting, payment methodologies, and industry benchmarks.CERTIFICATES/LICENSES/REGISTRATIONS:n/aKNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES/TALENTS:10+ years of progressive experience as a DBA and/or Data Architect.Ability to write complex SQL queries (SSIS desirable) and analytical functionsExperience designing and implementing data extract and transformation flowsAble to join multiple data sources into comprehensive datasets for analysis and reportingMust have Business Intelligence experience – preferably development in TABLEAUUnderstanding of Cloud technology, preferably GOOGLESolid organizational skills, including attention to detail, facilitation, and multitasking.Solid Understanding of Healthcare systemsThe ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams. Leveraging SMEs to craft creative solutions to move the needle on key business initiatives.Detail oriented with strong organizational skills, able to work under deadlines in a changing environment, and ability to manage and prioritize multiple initiatives simultaneouslyProven leadership skills, ability to prioritize, communicate clearly, and a consistent track record of deliveryOutstanding written and verbal communication skills with the ability to work with all levels of AEG organization – working with IT, Business Analysts, Practice Managers, Physicians, and Optical sales.Excellent executive presence and a track record of success working closely with C-Suite.Preferred experience in healthcarePreferred understanding of data and structure within the EHR system.Preferred location - Southern CaliforniaWillingness to travel to AEG locations approximately 20%. WORK ENVIRONMENT:The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounter while performing the essential functions of this job.This is primarily a sedentary office classification but may require field visits and driving. Temperature conditions are controlled with limited direct exposure to hazardous physical substances. The noise level in the work environment is usually low to moderate.While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, stand, walk, handle, or feel, reach with hands and arms, see, talk and hear. The employee will frequently lift and/or carry reports, records and other materials that typically weigh less than 20 pounds. The employee is occasionally required to stoop, kneel, bend, or crouch.Finger dexterity is needed to access, enter, and retrieve data using a computer keyboard, calculator, and other standard office equipment.
